summary.Title: Service/Troubleshooter High Voltage Technician THOR Offshore Windfarm
summary.JobHeadline: Service/Troubleshooter High Voltage Technician THOR Offshore Windfarm
summary.Presentation: RWE is building Denmark’s largest offshore wind farm. Thor offshore wind farm will be built 22 kilometres off the coast of Thorsminde on the west coast of Jutland with a capacity of more than 1 GW.

JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Service/Troubleshooter High Voltage Technician THOR Offshore Windfarm
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
RWE is building Denmark’s largest offshore wind farm. Thor offshore wind farm will be built 22 kilometres off the coast of Thorsminde on the west coast of Jutland with a capacity of more than 1 GW. 72 units of Siemens Gamesa’s flagship SG 14-236 DD offshore wind turbines are planned to be installed. Once fully operational in 2027, Thor will produce green electricity to more than 1 million Danish households.

Task of the role

Your main responsibilities will be maintenance and troubleshooting on HV systems for the substations located on – and offshore, the offshore wind turbines and export cables. You will have the daily responsibility for the safety within your area and will support an incident free culture.

During the construction phase of the wind farm, you will support the commissioning team with specific tasks linked to electrical safety, familiarization with the electrical equipment, and will be supporting the commissioning team with day-to-day tasks.

When construction is finalized, you will be a part of the production and maintenance team with close collaboration with the HV manager. Your base will be Thorsminde and rotation is planned for 1 week on/off with accommodation facilities provided if required.

Your future plans

  • Collect valuable lessons learned during the construction phase
  • Become Authorized as “” according to DS/EN 50110-1:2023
  • Plan and perform switching operations on HV equipment
  • Potential control room tasks, Alarm handling of substations, high voltage equipment, HV cables etc.
  • Service and Troubleshooting on HV assets On/Offshore
  • Documentation of all work with the help of electronic reporting (e.g. SAP)
  • Preparation of error reports and work instructions
  • Review and, if necessary, processing of operationally relevant documentation such as. maintenance manuals and installation circuit diagrams
  • Compliance with and testing of occupational health and safety requirements
  • Preparation of RAMS (risk assessments and method statements) for repairs, as well as control of RAMS by external service providers

Your profile

  • Completed training as an electrician or automation technician or equivalent educations is mandatory
  • 5-10 years of professional experiences as a technician in operating, servicing and maintaining High Voltage equipment / asset
  • Experiences in the field of protection systems, SCADA and communication, automation technology and network operations
  • Experiences in working offshore
  • Good IT skills (e.g. MS Office, etc.)
  • Good English language skill
  • Experiences in planning HV services
  • Be able to work offshore including GWO and HUET certificates
  • Strong awareness of occupational safety
  • Engaged team player with positive and solution oriented mindset

From here, you benefit from many further advantages – Curious? Then click here!

Apply with just a few clicks: ad code 89220, application period 2025-02-23.
Any questions? Contact HR: Magnus Aarenstrup, magnus.aarenstrup@rwe.com #LI-MA1
